meanings.sent1: The soil in our garden is regenerable, allowing us to grow new plants each season.
meanings.sent2: The regenerable batteries in this toy can be recharged multiple times.
meanings.sent3: The regenerable crayons magically refill themselves when they run out.
meanings.sent4: Her regenerable energy seemed endless, like a never-ending waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The regenerable forest showed signs of new life after the wildfire.

meanings.definition: Able to be renewed or restored.
meanings.sent1: The regenerable fabric of this shirt can withstand many washes.
meanings.sent2: With proper care, the regenerable skin cells can heal the wound completely.
meanings.sent3: The regenerable memories of their childhood brought smiles to their faces.
meanings.sent4: Her regenerable hope shone brightly even in the darkest times.
meanings.sent5: The regenerable spirit of the team lifted everyone's morale after the defeat.
